title: Close/Dismiss & Refresh webview
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN accessing an internal webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS] AND User display with Close CTA with blue color left corner and Refresh icon on right corner 

[Android] AND User display with Close CTA at left corner (shown as 'X') and Refresh icon on right corner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User tap on Refresh CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User should witness webview page refresh

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User tap on Close/'X' CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN User should be able to Close/Dismiss the webview 
AND User should be returned where the user initially accessed the webview

title: Use the module name as the title for the webview
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to a team page with a module that opens a Ballpark webview (internal)

[BP-9786](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9786 ) - iOS bug initially; Android behavior expected
custom_expected:
THEN the title for the page should use the same text as the module display name from the team page config

 

Example: Production LA Dodgers page
*Tap on ‚ÄúDodgers Rewards‚Äù
*Title shown: ‚ÄúDodgers Rewards‚Äù

Android/iOS: "Rewards"

custom_steps_separated.content: [REPEAT FOR DIFFERENT TEAM PAGES]
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the title for the page should use the same text as the module display name from the team page config

Android: 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14376522)

iOS: 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14376523)

title: [iOS Only] Email links direct to Mail app with email address populated
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12.0 or greater)*
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
WHEN User on Team Page 
AND user accesses an email hyperlink within an internal webview
custom_expected: THEN User should be directed to their email client with email populated

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User views the webview having an email hyperlink 

(i.e. D-Backs > Team Shop)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user display with email within the page 

i.e. TeamShop@Dbacks.com

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User tap on email hyperlink
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN email should launch the respective app when tapped inside a BP webview

AND if. not selected/set up the email service then user will display with the prompt to select option for email 

(Open with Outlook or gmail)

AND email should be auto populated within the email app

(i.e Outlook - To TeamShop@Dbacks.com) should be auto populated 

*slashes should NOT be added to the start of the email

title: [Android ONLY] Phone Dialer - with not provided Phone Permission
custom_preconds:
ANDROID:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6485

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1 or greater)
GIVEN a link is on a webview with the format tel:5551234
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

Team tab -> Reds -> Chat Now -> Purchase tickets -> Season Tickets (there is phone number listed as (513) 765-7500


Dbacks -> Team Shop -> 602-462-6701
custom_steps: WHEN User tap on that phone number link
custom_expected:
THEN user should be given a permission prompt for phone access 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13374701)

custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND user display with Prompt for allowing access 

Phone üìû icon 
Allow Ballpark app to make and manage phone calls? 

Allow 
Don't allow

title: [Android ONLY] Phone Dialer - Allowed Permission
custom_preconds:
ANDROID:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6485

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1 or greater)
GIVEN a link is on a webview with the format tel:5551234
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND User have allowed phone permission 

Team tab -> Reds -> Chat Now -> Purchase tickets -> Season Tickets (there is phone number listed as (513) 765-7500
custom_steps:
WHEN user tap on the link 
AND user allowed phone permission (This has to be done already or user can select Allow option on prompt)
custom_expected:
THEN User will be taken to phone's dialer app with the number prefilled 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13374695)

custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND user can make a phone call from dialer app 

(This is part of use case for additional verification)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user have no SIM card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be display with There's no SIM in your phone, so you can only make emergency calls.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dial the phone number with the SIM
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user able to successfully dial the phone number

title: Webview Deeplink - Cold Start (app closed)

ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpwa.venuetize.com%2FPWA%2FTexrq12raz%2F19%2Finitiate%3Fmodule%3DinSeatOrdering%26provider%3Dappetize%26type%3Dfnb&venueID=5325&dataTier=3

WHEN user has no favorite team selected in Ballpark
AND user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpwa.venuetize.com%2FPWA%2FTexrq12raz%2F19%2Finitiate%3Fmodule%3DinSeatOrdering%26provider%3Dappetize%26type%3Dfnb&venueID=5325&dataTier=3"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back/Close button from the opened webview

THEN user is directed back into the teams teamtab specified in the VenueID (if deeplink was accessed externally of BP app)
OR
THEN user is directed back to point of entry (if STEP 1 accessed the deeplink internally - such as a context card on home page)

WHEN user has a favorite team selected in Ballpark (other than Redsox)

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a webview should appear to the proper webview, after app opened

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back/Close button from the opened webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[ANDROID]
THEN user is directed back into the teams teamtab specified in the VenueID (if deeplink was accessed externally of BP app)
OR
THEN user is directed back to point of entry (if STEP 1 accessed the deeplink internally - such as a context card on home page)

[IOS]
THEN user is returned back to point of entry (or Home page, if accessed externally)
AND the TeamTab displays the logo and name of the user's fave team

title: Webview Deeplink - dataTier (optional)
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want to be able to open a link that takes me directly to a web app or informational page so I can easily access Ballpark's exclusive content

GIVEN a user selects a webview Deeplink 

"ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours"
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a webview with dataTier passed within the deep link

*dataTier is an optional field
custom_expected:
Wiki: [Data Tiers](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/1632206886/Data+Tiers)

THEN the user will visually witness same experience  
AND the value passed as dataTier dictates what is shown for the header

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP app is backgrounded
AND user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?dataTier=0&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a webview should appear to the proper webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back/Close button from the opened webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS] THEN user is returned back to the BP page previously on
[Android] THEN user is presented to the Team Tab previously set (OR user is presented the Team Picker, if no team prev established)

custom_steps_separated.content:
REPEAT ABOVE STEPS(1,2) replacing 'dataTier=0' with 
*'dataTier=1'
*'dataTier=2'
*'dataTier=3'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN same validation expected, as user will not witness a difference

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN dataTier deeplinks are preconfigured on team page, with different module types (i.e small image icon, carousel images, large button images, list links, etc.)

(QA env - Rockies Team page should have helpful links already setup - 2021)

WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules
(in QA env - Rockies Team Tab page, scroll down to see data tiers 0-3)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a page is shown with what is passed into the Request Headers

custom_steps_separated.content: for all data tiers:
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-vid should always show the value of the venueID (Rockies = 19), regardless of dataTier value 

*x-mlbam-vid => Unique venue identifier. Indicates the club and location for which a WebView is launched.

AND x-mlbam-cis should always show the value of the checked-in state (Y/N), regardless of dataTier value 

*x-mlbam-cis => Indicates whether the user is checked into the game.

NOTE: this value is not supported for Auto or TicketScan check-in (as of 10.5.0)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules for dataTier 0 through 2
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-okta should always show the value of the OKTA string for the user, when dataTier value is 0, 1 or 2
AND 'Authorization: Bearer' should NOT be a visible request header, when dataTier value is 0, 1 or 2

*x-mlbam-okta => Unique user identifier, persistent across devices and sessions.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules for dataTier 3
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-okta should NOT show the value of the OKTA string for the user (should NOT be visible), when dataTier value is 3
AND 'Authorization: Bearer' should show a value of encoded value string for the user when dataTier value is 3

*Authorization: Bearer => The Base64 encoded JWT, has OktaID and email among other things

title: Webview Deeplink - venueID (optional) [ANDROID ONLY]
custom_preconds:
As a Ballpark user, I want to be able to open a link that takes me directly to a web app or informational page so I can easily access Ballpark's exclusive content

GIVEN a user selects a webview Deeplink 

"ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours"

*venueID is an optional field
custom_expected:
THEN the user will witness the team selected on team tab of the corresponding venueID

[Team IDs & Venue IDs](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ticketing/pages/3947618/IDs+Team+IDs+Venue+IDs)

WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP app is backgrounded
AND user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?venueID=19&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours"

THEN a webview should appear to the proper webview
AND the team shown on the navBar should match the corresponding venueID passed (venueID=19 is Rockies)

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented to the Team Tab matching the corresponding venueID passed

title: Webview Deeplink - external (optional)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10190](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10190 ) / [BPA-6887](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6887 )

As a Ballpark user, I want to be able to open a link that takes me directly to an external page so I can easily access Ballpark's exclusive content

GIVEN a user selects a webview Deeplink 

"ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours&external=true"


ANDROID: ballpark://webview?url=https://www.mlb.com/app/ballpark/redsox/ballpark/tours&external=true [TODO:CONFIRM]
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a webview with venue passed within the deep link

*external is an optional field
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be prompted to open the deeplink external to BP app
AND if user accepts, the URL provided in the deeplink will open within an external browswer

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours&external=true"

ANDROID: ballpark://webview?url=https://www.mlb.com/app/ballpark/redsox/ballpark/tours&external=true
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN BP app opens a prompt from within internal webview: 
"Leave Ballpark - Would you like to leave Ballpark and open this link in Safari?' 
AND 'No' and 'Yes' options are presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN ‚ÄòNo‚Äô is chosen by the user
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the internal webview is dismissed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours&external=true"

ANDROID: ballpark://webview?url=https://www.mlb.com/app/ballpark/redsox/ballpark/tours&external=true
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a webview should appear to the proper webview
AND the team shown on the navBar should match the corresponding venueID passed (venueID=19 is Rockies)

THEN BP app opens a prompt from within internal webview: 
"Leave Ballpark - Would you like to leave Ballpark and open this link in Safari?' 
AND 'No' and 'Yes' options are presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN ‚ÄòYes‚Äô is chosen by the user
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is directed to an external webview loading the webpage passed as URL

title: [iOS ONLY] Webview deeplink parameter directing to modularized webview [DEPRECATED]

[BP-9755](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9755)

title: Webview Monitoring [iOS]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user Ballpark app installed on device  (11.2->iOS / 11.5->Android or greater)*
AND Background RUM event tracking is enabled 
AND Webview Tracking enabled 

[REQUIRES TRACKING OF 'INFO' TO BE ENABLED - 'datadog_log_level' w/in RemoteConfig set to level 1. IOS may have it set higher in Prod]


Following provides historical data for iOS:
*11.2 introduces monitoring to newly implemented iOS webview [BP-9693](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9693) (but only for Historic Checkin webview)
**(no need to verify legacy webview, implementation as monitoring was NOT implemented)
*11.4 introduces monitoring to newly implemented Chatbot webview [BP-9779](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9779)
*12.0 removes legacy webview and utilizes modularized webview throughout the app
custom_steps: WHEN user open any webview into Ballpark app
custom_expected: THEN user should be able to open webview where applicable in  to Ballpark app![](index.php?/attachments/get/13371835)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN Webview tracking enabled for URL Loads
AND the user loads a webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user witnesses the webview load
AND Datadog displays RUM session data with URL being loaded
AND Datadog displays log data with URL being loaded

(i.e. https://app.datadoghq.eu/logs?query=%40usr.email%3Asteve.ortiz.mlb%2Bbp9693%40gmail.com&index=&viz=stream&from_ts=1652126400000&to_ts=1652127900000&live=false )

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click on refresh to refresh the Webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user witnesses the webview refresh
AND Datadog displays RUM session data with URL being refreshed
AND Datadog displays log data with URL being refreshed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on 'back' arrow icon within the bottom nav on web view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user witnesses the webview navigate back a page
AND Datadog displays RUM session data with webview 'Navigate Back' action 
AND Datadog displays log data with webview 'Navigate Back' action

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user tap on 'forward' arrow icon within the bottom nav on web view
custom_steps_separated.expected:

title: Webview Monitoring [Android]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user Ballpark app installed on device  (11.2->iOS / 11.5->Android or greater)*
AND Background RUM event tracking is enabled 
AND Webview Tracking enabled 


*11.5 introduces monitoring for Android webview  [BPA-6454](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6454)
custom_steps: WHEN user open any webview into Ballpark app
custom_expected: THEN user should be able to open webview where applicable in Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN Webview tracking enabled for URL Loads
AND the user loads a webview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user witnesses the webview load
AND Datadog displays RUM session data with URL being loaded
AND Datadog displays log data with URL being loaded*

(i.e. https://app.datadoghq.eu/rum/explorer?query=%40usr.email%3Asteve.ortiz.mlb%2Bbpa6454%40gmail.com%20%40type%3Asession&cols=&event=AQAAAYJfdtoRnrbFLwAAAABBWUpmZHRvUkFBQVBNN0hDVEFXMXRRZ1Y&p_tab=attributes&from_ts=1659455764500&to_ts=1659459364500&live=false )

*To view URL:
**Navigate to RUM session for the user
**Tap 'View Load - com.bamnetworks.mobile.android.ballpark - Load Screen com.bamnetworks.mobile.android.ballpark.ui.webview.WebviewFragment' 
**Tap 'Attributes' tab
**Scroll to 'Custom Attributes' and view URL passed to ballpark_webview_url_key

**Confirm 'tap on ActionMenuItemView(menu_reload)' is shown

title: DD logs to Permission Allow/Deny
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user Ballpark App 12.4.0 and above 
GIVEN user webview with Geolocation
custom_steps: WHEN user display with prompt for geolocation permission for webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user allow(granted) permission for geolocation permission
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with logs in DD 

Granted permission requests: [android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION, android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user deny (denied) permission for geolocation prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with logs in DD 

Denied permission requests: [DeniedPermissions(permission=android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION, showRationale=true),

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has previously denied the permission
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should display with logs in DD

Permission previously denied once: android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION
